children.name: joy
content
pleased
children.description: Feeling or showing pleasure and satisfaction.

children.name: satisfied
children.description: Contented; pleased.
A state of peaceful happiness.

children.name: happy
amused
children.description: Finding something funny or entertaining.

children.name: delighted
children.description: Feeling or showing great pleasure.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.

children.name: cheerful
jovial
children.description: Cheerful and friendly.

children.name: blissful
children.description: Extremely happy; full of joy.
Noticeably happy and optimistic.

children.name: proud
triumphant
children.description: Feeling or expressing jubilation after having won a victory or mastered a difficulty.

children.name: illustrious
children.description: Well known, respected, and admired for past achievements.
Feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction as a result of achievements, qualities, or possessions.

children.name: optimistic
hopeful
children.description: Feeling or inspiring optimism about a future event.

children.name: eager
children.description: Wanting to do or have something very much.
Hopeful and confident about the future.

children.name: enthusiastic
zeal
children.description: Great energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or an objective.

children.name: excited
children.description: Very enthusiastic and eager.
Having or showing intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval.

children.name: elation
jubilation
children.description: A feeling of great happiness and triumph.

children.name: euphoric
children.description: Characterized by or feeling intense excitement and happiness.
Great happiness and exhilaration.

children.name: enthralled
rapture
children.description: A feeling of intense pleasure or joy.

children.name: enchanted
children.description: Delighted greatly; charmed.
Fascinated and spellbound.
A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.

children.name: love
affectionate
fondness
children.description: Affection or liking for someone or something.

children.name: romantic
children.description: Conducive to or characterized by the expression of love.
Readily feeling or showing fondness or tenderness.

children.name: longing
attracted
children.description: Feeling a pull or draw towards something or someone.

children.name: sentimental
children.description: Of or prompted by feelings of tenderness, sadness, or nostalgia.
A yearning desire.

children.name: desire
infatuation
children.description: An intense but short-lived passion or admiration for someone or something.

children.name: passion
children.description: Strong and barely controllable emotion.
A strong feeling of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen.

children.name: tenderness
compassionate
children.description: Feeling or showing sympathy and concern for others.

children.name: caring
children.description: Displaying kindness and concern for others.
Gentle and kind affection.

children.name: peaceful
satisfied2
children.description: Contented; pleased.

children.name: relieved
children.description: No longer feeling distressed or anxious; reassured.
Free from disturbance; tranquil.
An intense feeling of deep affection.

children.name: fear
scared
helpless
children.description: Unable to defend oneself or to act without help.

children.name: frightened
children.description: Afraid or anxious.
Fearful; frightened.

children.name: terror
hysterical
children.description: Deriving from or affected by uncontrolled extreme emotion.

children.name: panic
children.description: Sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety, often causing wildly unthinking behavior.
Extreme fear.

children.name: insecure
inadequate
children.description: Lacking the quality or quantity required; insufficient for a purpose.

children.name: inferior
children.description: Lower in rank, status, or quality.
Not confident or assured; uncertain and anxious.

children.name: nervous
anxious
children.description: Experiencing worry, unease, or nervousness.

children.name: worried
children.description: Anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems.
Easily agitated or alarmed; tending to be anxious; highly strung.

children.name: horror
dread
children.description: Anticipate with great apprehension or fear.

children.name: mortified
children.description: Cause (someone) to feel embarrassed, ashamed, or humiliated.
An intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust.
An unpleasant emotion caused by the threat of danger, pain, or harm.

children.name: anger
rage
hostile
children.description: Unfriendly; antagonistic.

children.name: hate
children.description: Intense dislike or ill will.
Violent, uncontrollable anger.

children.name: exasperated
frustrated
children.description: Feeling or expressing distress and annoyance, especially because of inability to change or achieve something.

children.name: agitated
children.description: Feeling or appearing troubled or nervous.
Intensely irritated and frustrated.

children.name: irritable
aggravated
children.description: Made more serious by attendant circumstances.

children.name: annoyed
children.description: Slightly angry; irritated.
Having or showing a tendency to be easily annoyed or made angry.

children.name: envy
resentful
children.description: Feeling or expressing bitterness or indignation at having been treated unfairly.

children.name: jealous
children.description: Feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements and advantages.
A feeling of discontented or resentful longing aroused by someone else's possessions, qualities, or luck.

children.name: disgust
contempt
children.description: The feeling that a person or a thing is beneath consideration, worthless, or deserving scorn.

children.name: revolted
children.description: Cause to feel disgust.
A feeling of revulsion or strong disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.
A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.

children.name: sadness
suffering
agony
children.description: Extreme physical or mental suffering.

children.name: hurt
children.description: Cause physical pain or injury to.
The state of undergoing pain, distress, or hardship.

children.name: sadness2
depressed
children.description: In a state of general unhappiness or despondency.

children.name: sorrow
children.description: A feeling of deep distress caused by loss, disappointment, or other misfortune suffered by oneself or others.
The condition or quality of being sad.

children.name: disappointed
dismayed
children.description: Cause (someone) to feel consternation and distress.

children.name: displeased
children.description: Feeling or showing annoyance and displeasure.
Sad or displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfill one's hopes or expectations.

children.name: shameful
regretful
children.description: Feeling or showing regret.

children.name: guilty
children.description: Culpable of or responsible for a specified wrongdoing.
Worthy of causing shame or disgrace.

children.name: neglected
isolated
children.description: Far away from other places, buildings, or people; remote.

children.name: lonely
children.description: Sad because one has no friends or company.
Suffering a lack of proper care.

children.name: despair
grief
children.description: Deep sorrow, especially that caused by someone's death.

children.name: powerless
children.description: Without ability, influence, or power.
The complete loss or absence of hope.
The condition or quality of being sad.

children.name: surprise
stunned
shocked
children.description: Cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset.

children.name: dismayed
children.description: Cause (someone) to feel consternation and distress.
So shocked that one is temporarily unable to react.

children.name: confused
disillusioned
children.description: Disappointed in someone or something that one discovers to be less good than one had believed.

children.name: perplexed
children.description: Completely baffled; very puzzled.
Unable to think clearly; bewildered.

children.name: amazed
astonished
children.description: Greatly surprised or impressed; amazed.

children.name: awe-struck
children.description: Filled with awe or wonder.
Greatly surprised; astonished.

children.name: overcome
speechless
children.description: Unable to speak, especially as the temporary result of shock or some strong emotion.

children.name: astounded
children.description: Shock or greatly surprise.
Succeed in dealing with (a problem or difficulty).

children.name: moved
stimulated
children.description: Encourage or arouse interest or enthusiasm in.

children.name: touched
children.description: Feeling gratitude or sympathy; moved.
Having strong feelings of sadness or sympathy, because of something someone has said or done.
A feeling of mild astonishment or shock caused by something unexpected.
